intro: Test your knowledge of this week's Herald news!

questions.question: Approximately how many flu hospitalizations have been reported in Rhode Island since October?
questions.explanation: Last month, Brown University Health announced a mask mandate requiring all staff, patients and visitors to wear either Level 2 or N95 surgical masks amid “very high” levels of respiratory illness, with the state seeing approximately 900 hospitalizations since October.

questions.question: How many books were reportedly targeted in book ban attempts in the US during the first eight months of 2024?
questions.explanation: In the first eight months of 2024, the American Library Association reported 414 attempts at censorship of “library materials and services” across the country, with 1,128 titles targeted for removal.

questions.question: Which independent concentration was not pursued by a Brown student 10 years ago?
choices: Perception of Digital Art and Design
questions.explanation: Ten years ago, Brown students completed independent concentrations in Contemplative Psychosomatic Medicine, Educational Neuroscience, Perception of Digital Art and Design, and Neuroaesthetics.

questions.question: Which coffee shop’s employees are seeking unionization?
questions.explanation: Sixteen baristas, prep cooks and tea and coffee specialists at Ceremony’s two locations in Providence are seeking higher base wages, paid sick leave and improved working conditions.

questions.question: The visiting RISD alums were a part of which band?
questions.explanation: The Rhode Island School of Design welcomed back class of 1974 alums Tina Weymouth and Chris Frantz for a screening of “Stop Making Sense,” a concert film for their band Talking Heads.

questions.question: Which artists just released deluxe editions of their albums this month?
questions.explanation: Sabrina Carpenter recently released “Short n’ Sweet (Deluxe)”, and SZA just dropped “SOS Deluxe: LANA”, making waves in the music world.

questions.question: Which Watson Institute committee started the annual spoken word and open mic event for Black History Month?
choices: Watson Institute’s Diversity and Inclusion Action Plan Committee
questions.explanation: The event began three years ago, when the Watson Institute’s Diversity and Inclusion Action Plan committee was tasked with creating programming for historical heritage months.

questions.question: What is Brown Women’s Basketball’s current Ivy League standing?
questions.explanation: Despite two impressive come-from-behind efforts, Brown women’s basketball lost back-to-back games on the road against Ivy League rivals Princeton and Penn.

questions.question: Which dish is not mentioned as a menu item at the newly opened Rong Chic restaurant?
questions.explanation: Wickenden Street recently welcomed its newest, spicy addition: Chinese restaurant Rong Chic. The eatery opened its doors for food tastings earlier this month, featuring dishes like tofu cheesecake, three pepper chicken and Mapo tofu.

questions.question: Who concluded his service as Rhode Island U.S. Attorney?
questions.explanation: In a Feb. 17 press release, Zachary Cunha ’98, the United States Attorney for the District of Rhode Island, wrote that he had submitted a letter of resignation to the Justice Department and White House earlier this month.
